MenueSystem

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • MenueSystem.Panel
      • MenueSystem.Label
        • MenueSystem.Button

  • public class Button
extends Label
    Maintains a multiState button that uses the size of its background rectangle to determine if the mouse is placed over it
    Author:
    Michael Letter

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class MenueSystem.Panel

        Panel.PanelState

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean selectable
      Determines if when clicked the button alternates between a selected and idle state

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void autoUpdateState(MouseInput mouse)
      Will AutoUpdate the State if this Button and is subPanels based on the position of the mouse Note: Subpanels will be made invisible if the button is idle or inactive and when only be visible of the button is selected Unless selectable == false; Then subPanels will be updated the same way they are in Panel Otherwise
      java.lang.String getMouseDownImage()
      Will return the Image used when the Button is being held Down
      java.lang.String getMouseOverIdleImage()
      Will return the Image used when the Button is Idle and the mouse is hovering over it
      java.lang.String getMouseOverSelectImage()
      Will return the Image used when the Button is Selected and the mouse is hovering over it
      Button.transitionState getSubState()
      Returns the substate of the button, this includes whether the mouse is hovering over the button, whether the button is being held down, ir if the button is simply idle.
      boolean isPointOver(float pointX, float pointY)
      Will return whether or not the given world coordinates describe a point over this button
      void setButtonDownImage(java.lang.String imageLocation)
      Will set the image this button will alternate between when using autoUpdateState and setState and will preload them if they are not already preloaded
      void setMouseOverIdleImage(java.lang.String imageLocation)
      Will set the image this button will alternate between when using autoUpdateState and setState and will preload them if they are not already preloaded
      void setMouseOverSelectImage(java.lang.String imageLocation)
      Will set the image this button will alternate between when using autoUpdateState and setState and will preload them if they are not already preloaded
      void setState(Panel.PanelState newState, boolean setSubPanels)
      Will Set the current State of the Given Button: if button has been marked as selectable(Defualt): IDLE: All SupPanels are invisible, INACTIVE, and are not Updated.
      void setSubState(Button.transitionState newState)
      Will set this buttons current SubState to the given state

    • Field Detail

      • selectable

        public boolean selectable
        Determines if when clicked the button alternates between a selected and idle state

    • Constructor Detail

      • Button

        public Button()

    • Method Detail

      • autoUpdateState

        public void autoUpdateState(MouseInput mouse)
        Will AutoUpdate the State if this Button and is subPanels based on the position of the mouse Note: Subpanels will be made invisible if the button is idle or inactive and when only be visible of the button is selected Unless selectable == false; Then subPanels will be updated the same way they are in Panel Otherwise
        Overrides:
        autoUpdateState in class Panel
        Parameters:
        mouse - current state of the mouse (x/y position, button states, etc.)

      • setState

        public void setState(Panel.PanelState newState,
                     boolean setSubPanels)
        Will Set the current State of the Given Button: if button has been marked as selectable(Defualt): IDLE: All SupPanels are invisible, INACTIVE, and are not Updated. SELECTED: All SupPanels are visible, IDLE, and updated Normally. INACTIVE: All SupPanels are invisible and INACTIVE. if button has not been marked as selectable: IDLE: SupPanels States are updated Normally. SELECTED: SupPanels States are updated Normally. INACTIVE: All SupPanels are invisible INACTIVE, and not Updated.
        Overrides:
        setState in class Panel
        Parameters:
        newState - the desired State
        setSubPanels - if True all SupPanels of this Panel will also be set to the given state in addition to this Panel. otherwise only this Panel is affected

      • isPointOver

        public boolean isPointOver(float pointX,
                           float pointY)
        Will return whether or not the given world coordinates describe a point over this button
        Parameters:
        pointX - x position of input point
        pointY - y position of input point
        Returns:
        true: if (pointX, pointY) is over current button, false otherwise.

      • getSubState

        public Button.transitionState getSubState()
        Returns the substate of the button, this includes whether the mouse is hovering over the button, whether the button is being held down, ir if the button is simply idle. Note, these states do not update until autoUpdateState() is called
        Returns:
        the current state.

      • setSubState

        public void setSubState(Button.transitionState newState)
        Will set this buttons current SubState to the given state
        Parameters:
        newState - the new state to be set to.

      • setMouseOverSelectImage

        public void setMouseOverSelectImage(java.lang.String imageLocation)
        Will set the image this button will alternate between when using autoUpdateState and setState and will preload them if they are not already preloaded
        Parameters:
        imageLocation - filename to the image to be used.

      • getMouseOverSelectImage

        public java.lang.String getMouseOverSelectImage()
        Will return the Image used when the Button is Selected and the mouse is hovering over it
        Returns:
        the Image used when the Button is Selected and the mouse is hovering over it

      • setMouseOverIdleImage

        public void setMouseOverIdleImage(java.lang.String imageLocation)
        Will set the image this button will alternate between when using autoUpdateState and setState and will preload them if they are not already preloaded
        Parameters:
        imageLocation - filename to the image to be used.

      • getMouseOverIdleImage

        public java.lang.String getMouseOverIdleImage()
        Will return the Image used when the Button is Idle and the mouse is hovering over it
        Returns:
        the Image used when the Button is Idle and the mouse is hovering over it

      • setButtonDownImage

        public void setButtonDownImage(java.lang.String imageLocation)
        Will set the image this button will alternate between when using autoUpdateState and setState and will preload them if they are not already preloaded
        Parameters:
        imageLocation - used when the button is being clicked

      • getMouseDownImage

        public java.lang.String getMouseDownImage()
        Will return the Image used when the Button is being held Down
        Returns:
        the Image used when when the Button is being held Down
